author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Indo Russian Cultural and Friendship Society jointly organised a Russian cultural dance event at Gem Park, Udhagamandalam, on Friday. A dance troupe of 11 members from Rostov region showcased Russian ballet, acrobatic dance, and sports dance. On their way to Udhagamandalam, the artistes visited Thekkampatti where the elephant rejuvenation camp is under way. They also interacted with mahouts and cavadis with the help of a translator to know more about the elephants.

Examination today

The Combined Civil Services Examination-II (non-interview posts) Group –IIA Services will be held here on January 24 between 10 a.m. and 1 p.m. Around 31,500 candidates are appearing for the examination at 110 centres.

A release from the District Collector Archana Patnaik said that as many as 110 chief superintends, nine flying squads, and 28 mobile units would be monitoring the examinations. Special buses would be plying to the centres.

Modi petitioned

Thakkalai Chandran, organising president of the Tamil Nadu Thyagikal Kazhakamm has urged the Prime Minister to consider providing 2 per cent reservation for heirs of freedom fighters in education institutions, public sector units, and special consideration in UPSC appointments.

He said that a separate department should be formed to ensure the welfare of freedom fighters, and their heirs.

Birth anniversary

The 119 birth anniversary of Nethaji Subash Chandra Bose was held at St. Michael’s Higher Secondary School here on Saturday. The chief guest was Vijaya Karthikeyan, Coimbatore City Corporation Commissioner.

A power point presentation on the leader’s life history, videos of freedom struggle, and INA was made on the occassion.
title: Russian artistes visit elephant camp
